citations.narrative:
Some of the acquisition records for animals acquired since the last inspection were incomplete. Specifically: the address,
license plate/state, and driver’s license number of the person from whom the 2 hedgehogs were acquired were missing
from the animals’ acquisition record; and there were no records of acquisition or record of animals on hand available at
the time of the inspection for one of the alpacas born on the premises in 2024 and the one wallaby that was born on the
premises in 2024.
Per this Section, exhibitors shall make and maintain complete records regarding the details of the acquisition and
disposition of animals in their possession to account for the sources of the animals and any animal transfers. The records
shall include any offspring born of any animal while in his or her possession or under his or her control; the name and
address of the person from whom the animals were purchased or otherwise acquired; the USDA license or registration
number of the person if he or she is licensed or registered under the Act; the vehicle license number and State, and the
driver’s license number (or photographic identification card for nondrivers issued by a State) and State of the person, if he
or she is not licensed or registered under the Act; the date of purchase, acquisition, sale, or disposal of the animal(s); the
species of the animal(s); and the number of animals in the shipment. The Licensee needs to prepare records of
acquisition and a record of animals on hand for these animals and ensure that the animal records are kept current for all
future animal acquisitions. Correct by 10/15/24.
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with Licensee.
*END OF REPORT*
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
Some of the acquisition records for animals acquired since the last inspection were incomplete. Specifically: the address, 
license plate/state, and driver’s license number of the person from whom the 2 hedgehogs were acquired were missing 
from the animals’ acquisition record; and there were no records of acquisition or record of animals on hand available at 
the time of the inspection for one of the alpacas born on the premises in 2024 and the one wallaby that was born on the 
premises in 2024.  
 
Per this Section, exhibitors shall make and maintain complete records regarding the details of the acquisition and 
disposition of animals in their possession to account for the sources of the animals and any animal transfers. The records 
shall include any offspring born of any animal while in his or her possession or under his or her control; the name and 
address of the person from whom the animals were purchased or otherwise acquired; the USDA license or registration 
number of the person if he or she is licensed or registered under the Act; the vehicle license number and State, and the 
driver’s license number (or photographic identification card for nondrivers issued by a State) and State of the person, if he 
or she is not licensed or registered under the Act; the date of purchase, acquisition, sale, or disposal of the animal(s); the 
species of the animal(s); and the number of animals in the shipment. The Licensee needs to prepare records of 
acquisition and a record of animals on hand for these animals and ensure that the animal records are kept current for all 
future animal acquisitions. Correct by 10/15/24. 
 
This inspection and exit briefing were conducted with Licensee.  
 
*END OF REPORT*
